intro: Mitraria tomentella, commonly known as the woolly mitraria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are covered in a dense layer of soft, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Mitraria tomentella is often found in coastal areas and is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
